answers.answer: Hi,Thank you for writing in on your Mom's behalf.Has your Mom's blood sugar been checked while she is having these symptoms?  It may be too high, or even too low for her. At her age, even though she is quite active, we usually loosen  diabetes control a little so that we can avoid low blood sugars, whch can be very dangerous especially in this age group(causing falls etc). If your Mom is still driving, I would suggest suspending this for a while until you figure out what is going on.If her sugars are fine, other things to review would include her blood pressure and medication side effects. Definitely speak with her doctor about this again before you leave town to see if there something else he/she would suggest doing.Take care.

question: My 90 year old Mother is experiencing a "feel funny" in the head usually after eating and she says she is not dizzy, but she needs help walking. She has had her veins checked this last week and has the veins of a "40" year old.  She has had a brain scan and nothing has shown up there.  She is diabetic but her sugar is fairly stable with a 3 month testing of 6.9.  This has only been going on for about 3 weeks and we do not know what could be causing it.  Her blood pressure is stable and usually below 130.She is still active (bowls once a week and goes out with friends very often)  I am planning on flying with her to Texas in May and do not want this to be happening while we are traveling.  Any ideas I can have our family doctor check out?  Thanks
title: 90 year old Mother
